definitions.definition: A valve , tap or faucet which regulates the flow of liquid or gas through a pipe .
A main shutoff for water to a home from a municipal supply. Usually these valves exist in pairs, one outside the property boundary and one inside the property boundary.
examples: If you have a burst pipe, turn the water off at the stopcock .

main_definition: A valve , tap or faucet which regulates the flow of liquid or gas through a pipe .
secondary_definitions: ( British ) A main shutoff for water to a home from a municipal supply. Usually these valves exist in pairs, one outside the property boundary and one inside the property boundary.
